result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Peter Culotti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ryan Peter Culotti is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ryan Peter Culotti was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $100.00 including all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for WORK AND TREATMENT. COURT ORDERED SENTENCE TO BE SERVED ON ES. 
Court STAYED the commencement until 03-18-2016.
Credit for 9 days
Consecutive to: any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Peter Culotti

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order Denying defendant's request for concurrent sentences. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for concurrent sentences in 15CM002303 and 15CM003225.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Justice point report received and filed.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve SIX MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for  9 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment. Court ordered sentence to be served on ES. COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 3-18-16.

Fine of $100.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges from bail on deposit. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
AS TO COUNT TWO: 
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

ON MOTION OF THE STATE COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. Violation report received and filed, no action taken.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed report and took no action today.   Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. Justice point report received and filed.  lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Petition for Appointment of Counsel and Affidavit of Indigency, received and filed.   Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Christopher Ertl as counsel for defendant.  Attorney  Christopher Ertl   accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the conclusion of this case.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  court ordered stayed  warrant cancelled.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 8-11-15 at 8:30 in branch 47. lr
Calendar call scheduled for 08-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 8-11-15
Justice Point Pretrial Report

15RM035587  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07/29/2015
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-04-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Paul J. Manley in court, defendant Ryan Peter Culotti not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense withdrew bail motion.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
